newsitem.title: USA: Sylvan Learning takes stake in Jostens.
newsitem.headline: Sylvan Learning takes stake in Jostens.

text.p: Sylvan Learning Systems Inc said on Monday it had made a minority investment in Jostens Learning Corp, which provides technology-based educational programs for students in kindergarten through 12th grade.
Sylvan would own 19 percent of Jostens' equity, through a preferred stock investment and dividends, the company said.
Sylvan also said it would incorporate Jostens' computer-based curriculum products into its educational programs, delivered through Sylvan Learnings Centers and contract educational services sites.
"This alliance brings many opportunities to better the market position of both organizations," said Dave Shaffer, chairman and chief executive officer of Jostens.

Jostens Learning was sold in June 1995 by Jostens Inc to a group led by Boston-based Bain Capital Corp. The company is now privately held by an investment group led by Bain and Information Partners affiliates, the company said.
